etymology.description: 孙(孫) (sūn, "grandson; descendant") refers to the surname Sun, and 子(子) (zǐ, "master; learned man") is a respectful title for a scholar or master. Together, 孙子(孫子) (Sūnzǐ, "Master Sun") refers to the ancient Chinese military strategist, Sun Tzu, author of 'The Art of War.'
etymology.interpretation: 孙子(孫子) (Sūnzǐ, "Master Sun") combines the surname Sun with the title 子(子) (zǐ, "master") to honor Sun Tzu as a learned and respected military strategist.

examples.chinese: 孙子是兵法大师(孫子是兵法大師)。
examples.english: Sun Tzu is a master of military strategy.

examples.chinese: 《孙子兵法》是古代军事经典(《孫子兵法》是古代軍事經典)，影响深远(影響深遠)。
examples.pinyin: 《Sūnzǐ bīngfǎ》 shì gǔdài jūnshì jīngdiǎn, yǐngxiǎng shēnyuǎn.
examples.english: The Art of War is an ancient military classic with far-reaching influence.

examples.chinese: 许多学者尊崇孙子(許多學者尊崇孫子)，研究兵法智慧(研究兵法智慧)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō xuézhě zūncóng Sūnzǐ, yánjiū bīngfǎ zhìhuì.
examples.english: Many scholars revere Sun Tzu and study the wisdom of military strategy.
